00027  * @brief  Reporter for outputting genotype results.
00028  * 
00029  */
00030 #ifndef _QUANTMETHODGTYPEREPORT_H_
00031 #define _QUANTMETHODGTYPEREPORT_H_
00032 
00033 //
00034 #include "chipstream/BioTypes.h"
00035 #include "chipstream/QuantMethodReport.h"
00036 #include "chipstream/TsvReport.h"
00037 //
00038 #include "util/Err.h"
00039 #include "util/Util.h"
00040 //
00041 #include <cfloat>
00042 #include <cstdlib>
00043 #include <cstring>
00044 #include <iostream>
00045 #include <string>
00046 //
00047 
00048 class QuantMethodGTypeReport : public QuantMethodReport {
00049 public:
00050 
00051   /** 
00052    * Constructor takes the prefix that will be used for output files.
00053    * @param maxNameLength      How long is the longest probeset name for determining field size in hdf5
00054    * @param outputForcedCalls  Should the forced calls file be written
00055    * @param outputContext      Should the context of the snp be output i.e. near another snp
00056    */
00057   QuantMethodGTypeReport(bool outputForcedCalls=false, bool outputContext=false, bool outputProbabilities=false, int probFileSampleCount=500);
00058 
00059   /** Destructor. */
00060   ~QuantMethodGTypeReport();
00061 
00062   /** 
00063    * Use a compact version of the file5 format with structure of:
00064    * /calls - with genotypes as single byte
00065    * /confidences - with confidences as a 4 byte float
00066    * @param maxNameLength Maximum probeset name length
00067    */
00068   void setCompactFile5Format(int maxNameLength=TSVREPORT_PROBESET_STRLEN);
00069 
00070   /** 
00071    * Get set up for a run of reporting probesets. Often used to open file
00072    * streams and print headers to files etc.
00073    * 
00074    * @param qMethod - Quantification method to be used.
00075    * @param layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
00076    * 
00077    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00078    */
00079   bool prepare(QuantMethod &qMethod, const IntensityMart &iMart);
00080 
00081   /** 
00082    * After every probeset computation this function is called an is an opportunity
00083    * to query the quantification method for results, residuals, etc.
00084    * 
00085    * @param psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
00086    * @param qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
00087    * @param layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
00088    * 
00089    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00090    */
00091   bool report(ProbeSetGroup& psGroup,
00092               QuantMethod& qMethod, 
00093               const IntensityMart& iMart, 
00094               std::vector<ChipStream *>& iTrans, 
00095               PmAdjuster& pmAdjust);
00096     
00097   /** 
00098    * No more probesets will be processed, this is a chance to finish outputting
00099    * results and clean up.
00100    * 
00101    * @param qMethod - Quantification method that was used.
00102    * 
00103    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00104    */
00105   bool finish(QuantMethod &qMethod);
00106     
00107   void registerProbeSetsToReport(std::set<const char *, Util::ltstr> *probeSetsToReport) {
00108       m_ProbeSetsToReport = probeSetsToReport;
00109   }
00110 
00111 private:
00112   /// Output stream for calls and confidences.
00113   affx::TsvReport m_CallsOutTsv;
00114   affx::TsvReport m_ConfsOutTsv;
00115   affx::TsvReport m_ContextOutTsv;
00116   affx::TsvReport m_ForcedCallsOutTsv;
00117   std::vector<affx::TsvReport> m_ProbabilitiesOutTsvVec;
00118 
00119   bool m_outputForcedCalls;
00120   bool m_outputContext;
00121   bool m_outputProbabilities;
00122   int m_probFileSampleCount;
00123 
00124   std::set<const char *, Util::ltstr> *m_ProbeSetsToReport;
00125   affx::File5_File *m_File5;
00126   affx::File5_Group* m_F5Group;
00127   int m_MaxNameLength;
00128   /// Should we output confidences as a float rather than a double and calls as a char
00129   bool m_DoCompact;
00130 };
00131 
00132 #endif /* _QUANTMETHODGTYPEREPORT_H_ */
